citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
During the IACUC semi annual inspection on 12 September 2023, a subcommittee comprised of only one member was
responsible for inspecting Building 4. Subcommittees must be comprised of at least two members to ensure accountability
for any findings. The facility must ensure that at least two members conduct inspections of all buildings.
Corrected by the March 2024 semi annual inspection.

Mobile work carts with equipment for handling animals and collecting blood were dirty, with excessive buildup of
dirt/blood/fur on alcohol bottles for cleaning ears, on restrainers for animals, and work surfaces. Inadequate cleaning of
spaces used to handle animals may become a source of physical contamination and/or stress to the animals. The facility
must ensure that all handling is done as carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause behavioral stress or
physical harm.
Correct by 09 August 2024.

Many feeders had sharp edges where rabbits had chewed on them, and/or had been contaminated with urine from rabbits
spraying. Food receptacles with sharp edges risk animal injury, and feeders that are not clean and dry may lead to
deterioration of the feed. The facility must ensure that the feeders are kept clean and in good repair.
Correction initiated during inspection, complete by 09 August 2024.

Multiple cages had a buildup of shed fur, feces and urine in a back corner, causing rabbits to have urine staining. Buildup
of wastes in cages prevents appropriate sanitation, and may adversely affect animal welfare. The facility shall ensure
cages are kept reasonably free of excreta and wastes.
Correction initiated during inspection, complete by 09 August 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.31(c)(3)  Repeat
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
During the IACUC semi annual inspection on 12 September 2023, a subcommittee comprised of only one member was 
responsible for inspecting Building 4. Subcommittees must be comprised of at least two members to ensure accountability 
for any findings. The facility must ensure that at least two members conduct inspections of all buildings. 
 
Corrected by the March 2024 semi annual inspection. 
2.38(f)(1) 
   
Miscellaneous. 
Mobile work carts with equipment for handling animals and collecting blood were dirty, with excessive buildup of 
dirt/blood/fur on alcohol bottles for cleaning ears, on restrainers for animals, and work surfaces. Inadequate cleaning of 
spaces used to handle animals may become a source of physical contamination and/or stress to the animals. The facility 
must ensure that all handling is done as carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause behavioral stress or 
physical harm. 
 
Correct by 09 August 2024. 
3.54(b) 
   
Feeding. 
Many feeders had sharp edges where rabbits had chewed on them, and/or had been contaminated with urine from rabbits 
spraying. Food receptacles with sharp edges risk animal injury, and feeders that are not clean and dry may lead to 
deterioration of the feed. The facility must ensure that the feeders are kept clean and in good repair. 
 
Correction initiated during inspection, complete by 09 August 2024. 
3.56(a)(1) 
   
Sanitation.

Multiple cages had a buildup of shed fur, feces and urine in a back corner, causing rabbits to have urine staining. Buildup 
of wastes in cages prevents appropriate sanitation, and may adversely affect animal welfare. The facility shall ensure 
cages are kept reasonably free of excreta and wastes.  
 
Correction initiated during inspection, complete by 09 August 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
